I can't even explain how good this place is. So many good choices of bread that's fresh and some combos that are to die for! BBQ sandwich is a fucking win! It's right off the 101 and Southern and is worth it for the price. You will NOT BE LET DOWN!

Great place in Phoenix for a good deli sandwich. Bread is hearty and the selection of sandwiches offers delicious dressings and fixings. Sandwiches are large and can be split when the hunger isn't as strong. I haven't tried the soup bowls, but my gal swears by them. 

Southwest Club is my fav! Give it a try.

Thinking of Dilly's focaccia bread makes my mouth water... Seriously this place is great and Ive been here or the other one in Tempe numerous times and never had a bad meal or bad service.
Personally I love the Yahoo (on focaccia of course!) or if you want something a little lighter, go with the Southwest chicken wrap.

Pretty sad it's taken me almost a year to eat at this Dilly's Deli despite the walkable distance I live within the shop. It's also disappointing that they've closed other locations down, but at least this one is still open! It's in a small, unassuming building right off of University. Just like with many of those restaurants in that stretch of University, the entrance/parking comes up quickly. 

I live for their fresh sandwiches! My favorites are Yahoo! and the Southwest Club, but most favorite is the Southwest Club on multi-grain. It's got some weird/funky fixins on the sandwich but makes for delicious bites. The most recent time I visited I [duh] ordered the Southwest Club + pasta salad. Normally for a side I'll get a side salad or chips but I wanted to mix things up, and the counter guy suggested pasta salad. Didn't end up being the greatest choice [lot of pasta, not a lot of other things + flavor], but live and learn. This location also has a Coke Freestyle machine! 

I highly recommend grabbing a table outside since it's got great views of the neighborhood.

Can't say a single bad thing about this place. First of all it was the best customer service I've had in a long time. I think they bake their own bread & it's amazing. The meat was delicious & the veggies were fresh. 
Glad I work right down the street so I can eat here often.
I love Dilly's Deli.I usually order the broccoli and cheddar soup bread bowl, while my husband prefers the sandwiches. The staff is always friendly when we go there for lunch.

Dilly's Deli is the perfect place to get a quick bite. I love their half soup and sandwich combos. When you enter the restaurant the workers are punching dough and the bread is always fresh. 

This location on University has tight parking area and the seating inside is also small. When waiting for your food almost at every turn you feel like your bumping into someone. Otherwise, the food is very fresh amd sandwiches are packed with yummy meats. 

My favorite thing to order is the southwest club in sandwich or wrap form  depending on what  I'm feeling. I always get the classic clam chowder in the bread bowl. It's  a comforting bowl of soup and it's  always fun to devour the whole bowl and dip the bread in the soup
 
The food is good but I had to take  a star off for the whole experience. I came during a busy time, my cashier kept mumbling and I could barely hear what he was saying. I know it's  busy but he could step it up with service. He also forgot to offer  me a water cup.

When I asked for suggestions  he just shrugged. Also, the ovens are going all the time they need to turn down the AC. Overall, I would come back hopefully  during  a time they are less busy and able to attend to everyone.
Very good deli. Fresh ingredients and good sandwiches. I would recommend the Dilly Bird, Smokey Mountain and the South West Club.

Good sandwiches and good fresh bread.

The people are nice.

The only downside is the amount of meat use could be a bit better.

Always one of the top sammich spots. The soup bread bowls are killer.. Only had the boston clam chowder though..

Fresh meats n bread on sammiches, just the right mix of portions..

Only issue is more menu variations, but pretty sure you can order anything that they have ingredients for.. Might ask them to spin up a cuban next time.

Always great sandwiches. The dudes on register could do with a bit less complete boredom on their faces but the managers are on top of things. It's super clean and they have classic sandwich options plus a few original ones. They're big but kinda pricey sandwiches too. Not a bad thing necessarily but if you're broke, go to subway or Cheba Hut honestly.

Great food but the staff is awful. The guy at the checkout was in a big hurry and I had no one behind me. After I asked what the rush was, he said that I was taking too long. They have a great menu and I wanted to try everything so I was looking the menu over. I said that I wasn't ready yet and he did a frustrated exhale and and shook his head NO as he looked down. 
I walked out and I will NEVER eat at a Dilly's again.

absolutely wonderfully delicioouuss!!! Dilly's Deli has a very large variety in the ingredients they offer which of course led me to taking forever to put together my order( but I was creating a masterpiece here) but after I finally got it together it was freaking delicious and hit every craving I was having. I got a turkey wrap with feta, cranberries, spinach, candid walnut, avocado and even raspberry vinaigrette on the side. I know it might not sound as delicious to you as it does to me but you get the idea of the creations you can put together here.

Lover got a meat lovers sandwich and all of their soups come in a bread bowl. He tried the potato soup and had nothing negative to say about his order. Along with soup they have chips and other pasta salads you can get on this side as well. 

Food smelled so dang good, I couldn't help devour the only thing i could get my hands on while I was driving which was the huge delicious pickle that came with the meal :)

My colleague put in an order for lunch and I decided to order with her. When the order arrived, I received the wrong item and my colleague didn't receive the chips that came with her basket. We called back and asked for them to correct the order. We were given no apology, just a "well I don't know when the driver is going to be able to come back". When they did come back, my correct order was drenched in salad dressing, so much that it was coming out of both the packaging it was wrapped in as well as the carry-out bag. It was inedible. Furthermore, my colleague's chips were completely smashed (there was a hole in the bag like someone had popped it and when she opened it the chips were nothing but crumbs). It almost seems like it was all done on purpose. First and last time I'll be eating Dilly's Deli.

Bomb.com!! I love Dilly's and just about everything on their menu. Some of my favorites are the Yahoo, Southwest Wrap, Sweet Leaf Turkey Wrap, Sweet Leaf Salad with Chicken, Blazin' Buffalo, Smokey Mountain, The Gobbler or any of their amazing hearty soups in a bread bowl! YUM! See I told you I love the whole menu!! I think I fell in love with Dilly's the first time I tried it! I'm lucky there has always a Dilly's location close to me. One of Arizona's local gems, in my opinion. Believe me, if you are having lunch with a friend and you don't know where to go, just go to Dilly's! They are pretty packed at lunch time for this reason, but I think they also allow call ahead or to-go orders. 

Oh yeah, I'm obsessed with their Focaccia bread. That is all.

Delicious as always. Don't get delivery unless you have no other option- just go pick it up, they get super busy at lunch. If you ask for no onions you are probably still getting onions. They have awesome soups, but they tend to run out of the best ones after lunch. One of my favorite places to go for sandwiches in Tempe! (They have other locations, too!)
Just one of those places you can get something quick and is way better than a fast food joint.

Long time customer to this location and have always enjoyed my visits. The sandwiches are all tasty and well made and the soups are just as good. The ingredients seem much higher than other sandwich shops and the combos they offer provide tons of great options. They've been in the same location for years now even though the shopping center they are located in has become a ghost town, the place is always busy during lunch times, which is another great indication of how well they're doing. Definitely a local favorite of mine.
Actually this place is worth trying out....the sandwiches on foccacia bread was great. During work week it does get a little busy at lunch. I would try this place again...G approved.

Went here for a light lunch and found it to be a nice, classic diner near ASU's Tempe campus. The parking lot was the first perk to this place, as not a lot of places near campus can boast of free parking. 

I had a small Greek salad, which came with a slice of toast. It filled me up and tasted really fresh! My friend got a soup bread bowl that looked really cozy and tasty. 

The staff was extra friendly and the overall vibe was very easy-going. I would come back! :)

I need to get myself over to Dilly's Deli soon- I have not been in awhile.  I really liked the potato soup in the bread bowl--- wow!  SO good.  So am craving it now.  

The lunch line would get really long though, if you can avoid the lunch rush, I would and go at an off-beat hour instead.

The bread is all really good here and the prices were good too.

The sandwiches are pretty decent. 
I really enjoyed the blazin buffalo. I would recommend not getting it on the foccacia though. I'd never had that bread so I decided to get it, and it was good. Super soft, but not right for the sandwich, since it has so much sauce. 
My boyfriend got the smokey mountain. He really dug it. The meat on the inside of the sandwiches are cold, but the bread is toasted.

The soup was good. I got the cream of broccoli, which was good. He got the cream of potato, which would have been better if it was hot.

Over all pretty good. The dudes weren't unpleasant, but not super friendly. It didn't turn us off from the place at all though.

Probably gonna pick this place over some better known sandwich shops.

Went here for a quick lunch on my way out of town. They have decent and mildly creative sandwiches.....don't bother if you love crazy flavors or variety. More for a bland palate. 
At lunch Dilly's was semi crowded with business people but the line moved fast. I had the monthly special "The Smokestack" (December)  with roast beef and turkey. I also got a bread bowl of cream of potato soup. I wasn't able to finish half a sandwich and a bread bowl of soup  (for $8 total). It was a very good amount of food for the money, made fresh. 

The bread for the bread bowl is white bread, so don't go getting all sourdough amped up. Overall satisfying, but unremarkable. It's convenient, fast and pretty good quality. A nice little deli with average service is a fine addition to the main road.

Dilly's features great, fresh sandwiches, salads and sides, served in generous portions, on a great variety of fresh breads.  The staff is always super-friendly and the joint is packed at lunch time, despite being in an otherwise almost completely dead strip mall that isn't doing anything to help draw in new blood.  Tip: go for the half sandwich and side or salad deal.  The "half" sandwich is much closer to a "full" sandwich, and it's a great value.  Part of the regular lunch rotation with the office gang.  Good stuff, Maynard!

Some of the best sandwiches west of the Mississippi!  The salads are good too, as are the fresh baked goods (i.e. cookies.)  I've seen a lot of friends slurp down and devour the soup in bread bowls too, so I imagine they are most excellent.  My only qualm with the place is the strange smell.  Whenever I do lunch there, I leave smelling like a french fry, even though they don't fry anything there.  What gives?  Still, despite this annoyance, I keep coming back for more delicious food.

Went to lunch Sunday of Memorial Day weekend. The music was too loud and all the booth tables were occupied or dirty. I'm sure the workers would have rather been else where. However, they still have the best Boston Clam Chowder and the featured sandwich of the month "Club West" was really tasty.

LARGE sandwiches. Delicious wheat bread. Try the tuna salad sandwich. If you're not real hungry, be sure and order just half. By all means, when asked about condiments, ask for the Russian mustard--tasty!

A must try! Great sandwiches - soups - and salads! Everything taste fresh and homemade. I especially love the bread and balsamic salad dressing! Once you try Dillys, you will never go to a chain sandwich shop again. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because the sandwiches have less meat than they used to.

One of the better sandwiches in Tempe. I've tried a good amount of their menu and loved everything I tasted. They have a promotion after ASU game days where they give you a discount based on how many points the Sun Devils score (they had 54 on Colorado last night so it's 54% off today). Can't beat that!

Wanted something different for lunch, went to Yelp and bam!  Rhonda had just put in a review for a place 5 minutes away.  It was fate!

Dilly's Deli was easy to fine, had lots of parking and a great mix of student and business customers.  As if the bucket of Dr. Brown's Soda wasn't enough to make me like it, "Looking for love in all the wrong places" was playing. (Followed by Van Halen's Animal. Interesting transition...)  

Menu is simple, sandwiches, wraps, salads and soup, and combos available for any 2 of those things.  I noticed they use Boars Head meat, which is nice. I got a 1/2 sandwich small soup - which actually less than a full sandwich at $6.29.  The sandwich was on a soft Italian style bread, cut at an angle.  Made for a better sandwich than I thought as it was toasted just a bit, but oh so soft on the inside.  The chicken salad was great.   And the small soup they gave came in a bread bowl - SO awesome.  It wasn't sourdough as I'd hoped, but it was a nice white.  That Wisconsin cheddar soup was way too yummy.  It felt more like bread dip.  And since I got mine to go, I got the whole loaf w/ soup on the side so I could create it myself once it was ready to be eaten.

The place is cute with nice outdoor and indoor seating.  Definitely a new regular spot for lunch!

I've never had anything bad here. The service only suffers a little during the lunch rush but both times I had bad service on the phone, the manager personally delivered my order with his appologies and a coupon/discount off my next order.That's what keeps people coming back to your place. (Owners-write that down) Their food is delish! And I am always mixing up my sandwiches, changing breads,toppings, etc. They've served up to 10 people in my party before and still got all of our orders correct! Their sandwiches are very different and imaginative. And did I mention delicious?? The Irish girl in me loves the Corned Beef sandwich! Mmm! Getting hungry! I know where I am going for lunch tomorrow! Oh! Treat yourself to the cookie for goodness sake! You deserve it!
Love it!  Great food.  My friend picks up a meal for me sometimes because it is very far from me.  I get the one with bacon and avocado, I forget the name of it.

The food looked fresh, I'll give it that. A small little spot among the restaurants in the "A" wing. There are some better prices around on things, but they have water, soda, chips, salads, and sandwiches. Really that's it. There is a small island with the salads and sandwiches, drinks on the wall behind and you are done. If you have more time invest your money in a restaurant near by. The food looks good, but not for the price. A simple wrap is 7.99, that's a meal near by.

I am a Midwest transplant who loves her corned beef! They have really mastered it out east! I was craving a solid roast beef sandwich for a while since moving here 2 months ago and I work near Dilly's. I decided to quiet the craving and give Dilly's a try. I hate to say it but I was so disappointed. I think the photo really speaks for itself. Either the person who made the sandwich was in a hurry or they are cutting back on the ounces of corned beef portions for the sandwiches!! But corned beef sandwiches are normally supposed to tower in between slices of bread and be practically tipping over on its side! I am sad to say it was not a winning sandwich, my craving was not satisfied, and I'm back to trying to find a real corned beef sandwich! I will say, the employees there are super nice! The restaurant is very clean!

I asked for a sandwich with extra mustard and got a sandwich with which the bread was literally soaked in a syrupy substance. If that's what the "mustard" is, do not sell it as a mustard. The sandwich is totally inedible. Waste of money. Don't think I'll be going back.

never again...ordered a tuna melt sandwich a bag of chips and a small soup for delivery $16 dlls plus tip later....the sandwich was cold a slab of cheese thats not melted yuck and the money down the drain ...when i called they said thats how it comes ...what a joke

Not bad.  Maybe 3.5 versus a 3.  

I ordered a full and a half sandwich for 2 folks.  Frankly two half sandwiches would have been plenty.

The big critique of this place (and I've been to two different ones) is that there's an awful lot of bread on these sandwiches.  I'm thinking ats why two half sandwiches would go pretty far for two people.

Had the potential of being a "hidden gem" given its strange location in an unfrequented plaza right off the highway. Unfortunately, the young man at the checkout counter was so unfriendly, impatient, and bro-ish. Him and the other three male workers were literally standing around but not at all eager to explain the ordering process or answer any questions. What made it worse? I was literally the ONLY customer in the entire store! Take a little pride in your job. Geesh! Definitely wasn't a pleasant or welcoming experience. Too bad because my sandwich was actually decent.

i go to Dilly's whenever i have the urge to slip into a carb coma because the portions are HUGE. we're talking one sandwich cut in half looks more like two full sandwiches.

i always build my own to load up on the veggies (gotta pretend like i'm being healthy). the best thing is, you could request everything but the kitchen sink in your sandwich and the price never changes. in fact, you could probably request they throw in the kitchen sink, and the price would remain the same. it seems to be one of the only places that doesn't charge a premium for avocado.

for people who like punch cards, Dilly's has one. as far as atmosphere, don't expect any. it gets crowded here during lunch and the service is not always friendly but always fast. it's a great place to go if you feel like wolfing down a gigantic sandwich before passing out at your desk.

I have been coming to Dilly's Deli for years.

Here's why I don't like them anymore:

1.) they no longer use Boar's Head brand meats.

As most everyone knows, BH meats are one of the highest quality meats.  Whatever new supplier they are using is not nearly as good.  I asked an employee why they changed suppliers and they said BH is too expensive.  I am sorry, but you did not lower your prices.  BH is much better quality than whatever crap they're using.

2.) I found out the secret to their delicious "homemade" creamy chicken noodle soup.

Apparently Dilly's simply uses a frozen chicken noodle soup (I believe the employee said it was Sysco) that they just add heavy cream to.

Yes, their creamy chicken noodle soup is delicious; However, I think I can manage to just make my own rather than pay $5 for not-even-close to homemade stuff.

3.) Most of their employees just don't care about the customer.  

You will see what I mean when you show up to Dilly's within 45 minutes - an hour of closing time.  On the last two visits, I have heard employees say they were not going to make any new soup because they just wanted to start cleaning up.  On one visit, they only had ONE soup left and instead of telling the customer that... they just waited until she named every other soup and told her they were out.  WHAT?!

Dilly's needs to step up their game again or they will lose my business for good.

3 stars for the creamy chicken noodle soup alone.  Even though it isn't homemade, it is still delicious in that bread bowl.
Very good, quality food. Soup in a bread bowl yum. We will be back over and over and over again
